stork.feather

Class Bell<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • stork.feather.Bell<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the supertype of objects that can ring this Bell.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Future<T>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Bell.As, Bell.AsBell, Bell.Promise, BellLoop, Crawler, Emitter, Emitter.ForEach, FTPChannel.Command, FTPListParser, Request, ThreadBell

    public class Bell<T>
extends Object
implements Future<T>
    A promise primitive used for stringing together the results of asynchronous operations and executing asynchronous handlers. All handling operations are performed in a separate dispatch thread. It supports callbacks defined in subclasses, chaining of results, deadlines, and back-cancellation.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  Bell.As<V>
      A Bell which is promised to the parent Bell on instantiation, and performs a conversion using the convert(T) method.
      class  Bell.AsBell<V>
      A Bell which is promised to the parent Bell on instantiation, and performs a conversion using the convert(T) method.
      class  Bell.Promise
      A Bell which is promised to the parent Bell on instantiation.

        public boolean cancel(boolean mayInterruptIfRunning)
        Cancel the Bell, resolving it with a cancellation error. This is here to satisfy the requirements of the Future interface.
        Specified by:
        cancel in interface Future<T>
        Parameters:
        mayInterruptIfRunning - Ignored in this implementation.
        Returns:
        true if the Bell was cancelled as a result of this call, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        Future.cancel(boolean)

      • sync

        public T sync()
        This is an alternative way of getting the wrapped value that is more convenient for the caller. It blocks uninterruptably and throws unchecked exceptions.

      • then

        protected void then(T object)
             throws Throwable
        This is called when a Bell this Bell was promised to has rung. By default, it simply rings this Bell with object. Any Throwable thrown by this method will cause then(Throwable) to be called with that Throwable.
        Parameters:
        object - the value of the parent Bell.
        Throws:
        Throwable

      • then

        protected void then(Throwable error)
             throws Throwable
        This is called when a Bell this Bell was promised to has failed. By default, it simply rings this Bell with error. Any Throwable thrown by this method will be discarded.
        Parameters:
        error - the error the parent Bell was failed with.
        Throws:
        Throwable

      • done

        protected void done()
             throws Throwable
        This handler is called when this Bell has rung. Subclasses can override this to do something when the Bell has been rung. These will be run before waiting threads are notified. Any exceptions thrown will be discarded. Implement this if you don't care about the value.
        Throws:
        Throwable

      • done

        protected void done(T object)
             throws Throwable
        This handler is called when this Bell has rung and is passed the rung value. Subclasses can override this to do something when the Bell has been rung. These will be run before waiting threads are notified. Any exceptions thrown will be discarded. Implement this if you want to see the value.
        Parameters:
        object - the resolution value of this Bell.
        Throws:
        Throwable

      • fail

        protected void fail()
             throws Throwable
        This handler is called when the Bell has rung with an exception. Subclasses can override this to do something when the Bell has been rung. These will be run before waiting threads are notified. Any exceptions thrown will be discarded. Implement this if you don't care about the error.
        Throws:
        Throwable

      • fail

        protected void fail(Throwable error)
             throws Throwable
        This handler is called when the Bell has rung with an exception, and is passed the exception. Subclasses can override this to do something when the Bell has been rung. These will be run before waiting threads are notified. Any exceptions thrown will be discarded. Implement this if you want to see the error.
        Parameters:
        error - the Throwable this Bell failed with.
        Throws:
        Throwable

      • always

        protected void always()
               throws Throwable
        Subclasses can override this to do something when the Bell has been rung. These will be run before waiting threads are notified. Any Exceptions thrown will be discarded. This will always be run after either done(Object) or fail(Throwable).
        Throws:
        Throwable

      • promise

        public <V extends Bell<? super T>> V promise(V bell)
        Promise to ring another Bell when this Bell rings. Promised Bells will ring in the order they are promised and after this Bell's handlers have been called.
        Parameters:
        bell - the Bell to promise to this Bell.
        Returns:
        The value passed in for bell.

      • promise

        public Bell<T> promise(BellHandler.Done done)
        Return a Bell promised to this Bell which will run the given handler on success.

      • promise

        public Bell<T> promise(BellHandler.Fail fail)
        Return a Bell promised to this Bell which will run the given handler on failure.

      • promise

        public Bell<T> promise(BellHandler.Always always)
        Return a Bell promised to this Bell which will run the given handler on ring.

      • detach

        public Bell<T> detach()
        Return a new Bell promised to this Bell. This can be used to avoid leaking references to Bells.

      • as

        public final <V> Bell<V> as(V done)
        Return a Bell which will ring with done when this Bell rings successfully.
        Parameters:

      • as

        public final <V> Bell<V> as(V done,
             V fail)
        Return a Bell which will ring with done if this Bell rings successfully and fail if this Bell fails.
        Parameters:
        done - the value to ring the returned Bell with on success.
        fail - the value to ring the returned Bell with on failure.

      • deadline

        public Bell<T> deadline(double deadline)
        Set the deadline of the Bell in seconds. The deadline is relative to the time this method is called. If the Bell is not rung in this time, it will be resolved with a TimeoutException.
        Parameters:
        deadline - the time in seconds after call time that the Bell may remain unresolved.

      • promisesCompleted

        public boolean promisesCompleted()
        Check if this Bell has at least one promise and all promises have completed. This can be used by subclasses to implement backward-flowing cancellations, for example for requests that are cancelled by its requestor(s) and whose operation may thus be cancelled, or for "whichever responds first" patterns.

        If this Bell is in the process of ringing or has already rung, this method returns false regardless of the state of its promises during its lifetime.

        Returns:
        true if there are one or more promised Bells and they have all completed; false otherwise.

        public static Bell<?> rungBell()

        Returns:
        A Bell that has already been rung with null.

        Parameters:
        deadline - the time in seconds after this call that Bell will ring.

        Parameters:
